page.title: 06RELIGION IN DRUMOAK
page.content: The main religion of the people of Drumoak is that of the Scottish Protestants - Presbyterianism. The Parish Church was opened in November, 1836, the Rev. Dr. Corbett being the minister of the parish. Today the minister is the Rev. Dr. W. Serle, who lives in the manse on the south side of the North Deeside Road. The adult membership is 279 and 39% of the school children attend Sunday School classes. Roman Catholics and Episcopalians attend churches in nearby Banchory whilst other sects meet in Aberdeen.The self supporting United Free Church closed in 1950's when ownership went back to the laird who wished that the building be used by the local community as a hall. Between 1/3 - 1/4 of the population of Drumoak have no church connections.
